SEARCH
Package CORE

Class Simulation

java.lang.Object
CORE.Simulation
public class Simulation extends Object
Manages and executes the simulation process. This class orchestrates the event-driven simulation loop, processes events from the PEC, updates the simulation state, and provides periodic observations and final results.

  • Field Summary

  • Field Details

    • context

      private final Simulation_Context context
      The central Simulation_Context holding all shared simulation data, parameters, and references to other core components.

  • Constructor Details

    • Simulation

      public Simulation(Simulation_Context context)
      Constructs a new Simulation instance with the given simulation context.
      Parameters:
      context - The Simulation_Context that defines the simulation environment.

  • Method Details

    • run

      public void run()
      Runs the main simulation loop. This method performs the following steps:
      1. Prints initial simulation parameters.
      2. Enters a loop to process events from the PEC in chronological order.
      3. Periodically prints observations (every tau/20 time units).
      4. Executes each event and updates the simulation time.
      5. Continues until no more events are left or the simulation time exceeds tau.
      6. Prints any remaining observations to reach 20 total observations.
      7. Identifies and prints the "best fit" individual at the end of the simulation.

    • printInputParameters

      private void printInputParameters(SimulationParameters params)
      Prints the initial simulation parameters to the console. This includes grid dimensions, start/end points, counts of special zones/obstacles, and various simulation constants. Special cost zones and obstacles are listed in a detailed format if present.
      Parameters:
      params - The SimulationParameters object containing all initial settings.

    • printObservation

      private void printObservation(int obsNum, int time, int events, int popSize, boolean hit, Individual best)
      Prints the details for a specific observation point during the simulation. This includes the observation number, current time, number of events processed so far, current population size, whether the target has been reached, and details of the best fit individual (its path and either cost if target reached, or comfort).
      Parameters:
      obsNum - The sequential number of this observation.
      time - The simulated time at which this observation is made.
      events - The total number of events processed up to this observation time.
      popSize - The current total size of the population (alive + dead individuals).
      hit - A boolean indicating if the best individual has reached the final point.
      best - The Individual identified as the best fit at this observation time, or null if none.

    • printBestFitIndividual

      private void printBestFitIndividual(Individual best)
      Prints the final "best fit" individual identified at the end of the simulation. This includes its path and the final cost.
      Parameters:
      best - The Individual identified as the best fit at the end, or null if none.

    • findBestIndividual

      private Individual findBestIndividual()
      Finds the "best fit" individual among all individuals in the population. The criteria for "best fit" are:
      1. Any individual that has reached the target destination, prioritizing the one with the lowest path cost.
      2. If no individual has reached the target, then the individual with the highest "comfort" level among all individuals.
      Returns:
      The Individual deemed best fit according to the criteria, or null if the population is empty.
